name: Hilton Sandestin Beach, Golf Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Unfortunately, this is my first negative review on TripAdvisor. After spending a great week in Seaside, we needed to book a hotel room for one night b4 returning home from our summer vacation. We are frequent visitors to the South Walton Beach area and have often admired the Hilton Sandestin complex...from Hwy 98. We booked a room with 2 queen beds on Hotels.com and were anxious to spend a restful evening in beautiful surroundings. After check-in, much to our surprise, we found the room that we were given had not been cleaned with unmade beds. When we returned to the front desk, the college interns (who, by the way, were GREAT) were very apologetic and offered to upgrade us to a room in the newest building in the complex. We accepted, although it was a King room (with sofa bed) as there were no available rooms with two beds.
reviews.title: (San)Destin Disappointment

likes.liked: — The college interns working the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Notes from the "upgraded" room: carpet stains, "scuffed" walls in need of paint, stains on sheets, no pillows for sofa bed - they arrived approx 45 minutes after a request was made - unfortunately, they too had stains, and stains on shower curtain.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish we had consulted TripAdvisor before booking as we passed the Residence Inn and Courtyard by Marriott @ Grand Boulevard enroute to the Hilton. Either would have been a better choice for a comfortable night's stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with excellent location

reviews.text: Hotel started off shaky. We arrived and our room wasn't ready and we had to wait 1 hour for the room. That wait was quickly forgotten when we were notified that because of our wait our jr. suite room had been upgraded to an executive suite. Problem solved!! The hotel grounds are very well maintained. Food all around the hotel is very pricey and nothing to write home about. Lunch for wife and I averaged $30. I suggest buying your own beach chairs and umbrella if you are staying more than a couple days. They rent them for $40 a day. The $10 charge per day for standard parking is lame. Pools are great and clean.
reviews.title: Great time , wonderful view at the Hilton

likes.liked: — the ocean view, the pools and beach front location.. also live music everyday at bar.
likes.disliked: — getting in and out of the complex, jellyfish in the water pricy food

reviews.text: Beautiful location!! Our room had a nice beach front view. Convenient location as well, next to Village of Baytown warf. We were able to use the shuttle. They had excellent customer service. The only downside is if you have to use their business center (internet, copy machine fax) its really expensive, other than that, this place is excellent, Its definitely worth the money to stay at a nice place.
reviews.title: Great for kids

likes.disliked: — Price of breakfast, lunch, umbrellas & beach chairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Sandestin for our Honeymoon. We were there from May 11th to May 15th, 2008. The hotel is beautiful and the customer service is outstanding. It was the best customer service we had ever experienced from the time we drove in through the person at the security gate until we left. We had a great queen suite (with the extra bunk beds) on the 14th floor that was ocean view but had a wonderful view of the resort and the ocean. We really liked the fact that we could just walk right out to the beach. The beds were super comfy and the tv's in the room were huge. If you are planning to go to Destin, definitely book at the Hilton and check out their spa which was very nice.
reviews.title: Loved Hilton Sandestin!!!

likes.liked: — The proximity to the beach, the customer service, and the great ocean views.
likes.disliked: — The food (on the onsite restaurant) was a bit expensive. Not much parking for non valet visitors.

reviews.text: -The hotel room was incredible. Outstanding view of the beach, which is one of the best beaches in North America. The room needed a little updating but the bed and the layout of the room more than made up for older carpet and wallpaper. No matter what the cost of the upgrade, take the balcony rooms, they are worth it. Although it was pretty chilly in the evenings this time of year, the beach was very nice, even in bathing suit's.
reviews.title: Awesome Resort

likes.disliked: — Speed of service at check in/out.

reviews.text: -The bed was very comfortable, large, and plush.
reviews.title: Bunk Beds in Room

reviews.text: -The room had a stocked refrigerator;however, you had to call down to housekeeping to have it stocked.
reviews.title: Great beach, but a little stuffy

likes.disliked: — Nickel and dime approach to pricing

reviews.title: Enjoyable Visit
reviews.text: -The hotel rest. was very good, but very expensive ($18.00+tax). Lunch was more moderate ($10-14). The hotel bar was exceptional, good selection, but did not have enough staff to work during the weeknights. The Oyster bar outside, but on the hotel property, made eating at the hotel nice (very good selection).

We stayed at this property with our infant daughter in July and had a great time. We stayed in the spa building. The room was older, but huge (a plus for families). Also, the view of the ocean was great - the beach is perfect there. To be fair, we upgraded with Hilton Honors, so we might have had a better room and view. With regard to the positives, the place is perfect if you like to run or walk in the mornings. There are jogging trails and you can even walk/run to Starbucks and shops which are only a half a mile or so away (they also sell Starbucks onsite if you're lazy :) ). It also was great because there is a nice indoor pool so we could get our little one out of the sun. On the downside, like I said, the rooms are older. Also, the breakfast is pretty high ($20) for what it is. Overall though, a good choice for families.
reviews.title: Not sure what all the bad reviews are about...

reviews.text: My husband began working for his company in 1993. Since then, I have visited the Sandestin Hilton over 25 times for conferences and conventions. My next trip will be 8-8-08 through 8-12-08 and here are some preparations I will make:
reviews.title: Over 25 trips to Sandestin Hilton

reviews.text: * I will bring Tilex Mildew Remover Spray and I will spray the entire bathroom as soon as I hit the room. The caulking in the tub will be mildewed and there will be a general appearance of "not really clean" that I will take care of myself before putting my naked feet on the tile floor or my naked bum on the potty.
reviews.title: Beware! Beware!

reviews.text: * I will bring two scented candles to enjoy during my stay. I know that if I get a room in "the old section" (the tallest building of guest rooms) it will smell like mildew because there has been hurricane damage (minor, but wet) over the years and once the carpet gets wet, there is absolutely nothing anybody can do to really get it dry.
reviews.title: Sandestin Hilton has some problems

likes.liked: — Leaving and going to a pleasant condo on Holiday Isle

reviews.text: * A reservation has been made for one of the corner rooms with the wrap-around balcony. If something happens and I am downgraded to a Jr. Suite, I will INSIST that I get a room as far away from the elevator as possible to avoid all-night noise from partiers who do not sleep. If I am offered a room above the third floor, I will refuse because I will only hoof three flights of stairs, knowing that the elevators take forever if you get on an upper floor. Also, I will NOT open the curtains during mid-day in a corner room since, with the added windows in the corner room, it is impossible to cool the room. Continuing to crank down the air conditioning until it is set on 60 will only freeze up the unit.
reviews.title: Awesome Resort / High Prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wife and I had a great stay at the Hilton from Aug 23rd thru the 27th. Yes we had to deal with Fay but I'm really not sure what all the bad reviews are about... This is my first time to Destin and after driving around looking at the other places I about booked I'm glad I booked the Hilton. For those who don't know the Hilton is one of the few hotels actually on the beach.... Trust me if you go to Destin you want to be close to the beach and I don't get walking across the street or driving to the beach... Here we were able to walk our door and be in the sun in 5 mins... A few tips yes bring your own chair the set up is high also stock up for breakfast food at the local Wal-Mart... Don't waste your money on the breakfast... For those who don't know the Hilton is actually within Sandestin Golf and Beach resort (which is a full ownership condo townhome etc.) anyway you get all the advantages of owning one of these by staying at the Hilton... This includes a shuttle to and from Baytown Warf... Trust me it's nice to have at 2 am..... Great Stay and we will be coming back..
reviews.title: Hilton was great

likes.liked: — Was able to bring out dog
likes.disliked: — Did have a smoking room due to having a dog but the location was worth it... All dog rooms are right next to the beach

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton on August 16 - 20, 2008. I attended a conference at the hotel while my husband tagged along.
reviews.title: Very nice stay at the Hilton

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel early and asked for an early check in. The front desk took our cell phone number and said they would call us as soon as our room was ready. We walked out by the pool and waited at the poolside bar. To our surprise, our room was ready within 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Worth the wait

likes.disliked: — People that don't pick up their trash.

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is quite pricey at $20 each; however, if you ask for a menu you can order from it for a lot less money. We got a full 2 egg breakfast for $7.50 each morning.
reviews.title: Not up to the Hilton Standard

reviews.text: Our room was nice and looked directly over the beach. It was clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Loved it the 2nd time around!!!

likes.liked: — Beautiful place on beautiful beach. Breathtaking

aka: Hilton Sandestin Beach, Golf Resort And Spa
description: Hilton Sandestin Beach Golf Resort & Spa offers guests beachfront paradise with six restaurants, three bars, three pools, two whirlpools, four championship golf courses and Serenity by the Sea Spa.
